page.title: 10Social Concern 2
page.content: "Vandalism,noise and filth will result if Torquay plans for a campsite go ahead".Over 100 local residents filled the ballroom at the Maidencombe House Hotel to hold a public meeting to fight the plans of Mr.Jeremy part of Port Talland Farm to use three fields for camping. In June 1985 Torquay United Football Club wanted a training pitch on Great Hill near the resevoir. Although the pitch would be out of the area the people of Maidencombe were concerned about this.Through pressure from the Great Hill Protection Committee Torquay United were not allowed to buy the land.
